definition[0]: a change in a price, amount, level etc
definition[1]: the movement of prices, income, rates etc as they increase and fall
example[2]: Fluctuationsin profits resulted from differences between the volume of sales and the volume of production.
example[3]: Buying patterns are usually subject to upward or downward fluctuation caused by changes in the market.
example[4]: Although market fluctuations are inevitable, the stock and futures markets are basically solid.
